TEI.2.document_title: John W. Hall to L. R. Kenny, June 4, 1827

barker_notes.barker_summary: John W. Hall to L. R. Kenny, June 4, 1827. Asking aid in correcting false statements.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1656

div1.p: John W. Hall to L. R. Kenny, June 4, 1827. Asking aid in correcting false statements.

body.div1:
Mr L R Kenny
Dear sir
I saw a few lines written By coln Austin to Mr Warren informing him his petition could not Be Received I think that their Has Been some false and malisious statements made against Mr Warren and I wish you would Enquire in to it and iff so you will assist Him as a friend and it will accomodate yours with Respect
John W Hall
